meanings.definition: A small, bony flap covering the gills of a fish.
meanings.sent1: The opercele helps protect the delicate gills of the fish.
meanings.sent2: The fish's opercele moved gently as it breathed underwater.
meanings.sent3: The opercele of the fish fluttered comically when it tried to swim backwards.
meanings.sent4: Like a tiny shield, the opercele guards the fish's breathing organs.
meanings.sent5: The opercele, resembling a tiny door, swings open and closed with the fish's movements.

meanings.definition: To operate or function as a cover or lid.
meanings.sent1: The machine will opercele automatically when you press the start button.
meanings.sent2: Please make sure to opercele the container tightly to keep the contents fresh.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if the magic wand can opercele as a lid for the treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to opercele as a protective shield against any negativity.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella operceles over us, shielding us from the raindrops falling from the sky.
